verses.verse: Moreover the LORD <WH3068> answered <WH6030> Job, <WH347> and said, <WH559>
Shall he that contends <WH7378> with the Almighty <WH7706> instruct <WH3250> him? he that reproves <WH3198> God, <WH433> let him answer <WH6030> it.
Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> the LORD, <WH3068> and said, <WH559>
Behold, <WH2005> I am vile; <WH7043> what <WH4100> shall I answer <WH7725> you? I will lay <WH7760> my hand <WH3027> on my mouth. <WH6310>
Once <WH259> have I spoken; <WH1696> but I will not answer: <WH6030> yes, twice; <WH8147> but I will proceed <WH3254> no <WH3808> further.
Then answered <WH6030> the LORD <WH3068> to Job <WH347> out of the whirlwind, <WH5591> and said, <WH559>
Gird <WH247> up your loins <WH2504> now <WH4994> like a man: <WH1397> I will demand <WH7592> of you, and declare <WH3045> you to me.
Will you also <WH637> cancel <WH6565> my judgment? <WH4941> will you condemn <WH7561> me, that you may be righteous? <WH6663>
Have you an arm <WH2220> like God? <WH410> or can you thunder <WH7481> with a voice <WH6963> like <WH3644> him?
Deck <WH5710> yourself now <WH4994> with majesty <WH1347> and excellency; <WH1363> and array <WH3847> yourself with glory <WH1935> and beauty. <WH1926>
Cast <WH6327> abroad <WH6327> the rage <WH5678> of your wrath: <WH639> and behold <WH7200> every <WH3605> one that is proud, <WH1343> and abase <WH8213> him.
Look <WH7200> on every <WH3605> one that is proud, <WH1343> and bring <WH3665> him low; <WH3665> and tread <WH1915> down the wicked <WH7563> in their place. <WH8478>
Hide <WH2934> them in the dust <WH6083> together; <WH3162> and bind <WH2280> their faces <WH6440> in secret. <WH2934>
Then will I also <WH1571> confess <WH3034> to you that your own right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> can save <WH3467> you.
Behold <WH2009> now <WH4994> behemoth, <WH930> which <WH834> I made <WH6213> with you; he eats <WH398> grass <WH2682> as an ox. <WH1241>
See <WH2009> now, <WH4994> his strength <WH3581> is in his loins, <WH4975> and his force <WH202> is in the navel <WH8306> of his belly. <WH990>
He moves <WH2654> his tail <WH2180> like <WH3644> a cedar: <WH730> the sinews <WH1517> of his stones <WH6344> are wrapped <WH8276> together.
His bones <WH6106> are as strong <WH650> pieces of brass; <WH5154> his bones <WH1634> are like bars <WH4300> of iron. <WH1270>
He is the chief <WH7225> of the ways <WH1870> of God: <WH410> he that made <WH6213> him can make his sword <WH2719> to approach <WH5066> to him.
Surely <WH3588> the mountains <WH2022> bring <WH5375> him forth food, <WH944> where <WH8033> all <WH3605> the beasts <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> play. <WH7832>
He lies <WH7901> under <WH8478> the shady <WH6628> trees, in the covert <WH5643> of the reed, <WH7070> and fens. <WH1207>
The shady <WH6628> trees cover <WH5526> him with their shadow; <WH6752> the willows <WH6155> of the brook <WH5158> compass <WH5437> him about.
Behold, <WH2005> he drinks <WH6231> up a river, <WH5104> and hastens <WH2648> not: he trusts <WH982> that he can draw <WH1518> up Jordan <WH3383> into <WH413> his mouth. <WH6310>
He takes <WH3947> it with his eyes: <WH5869> his nose <WH639> pierces <WH5344> through snares. <WH4170>
